wanted to share something that helped me tremendously when it comes to dealing with my anxiety and something that increased my life satisfaction overall if nothing stick around for the funny story at the end who am year old male who has had anxiety until the age of so most of my life didn t know had it until started going to therapy was always the person who everyone told to relax but never know what that meant was relaxed in my perception of myself everyone told me was always so tense in my thinking and ways of life remember constantly going through tough read bad situations in my mind for example in my thoughts was perhaps fighting someone or someone was attacking me from the shadows when was walking in shady alley this never happened in real life but my mind has made it up had lot of thoughts where argued with people never to reach happy ending or an agreement it always ended with conflict so unrelated to all of this started going to psychotherapy after year of going perhaps once or twice week started recognizing more and more what anxiety was it was sometimes mixed with what like to call depression but my psychotherapist refuses to accept that because it s not chronic and agree it was not chronic but more like daily occurences of emptied out reserves of happy molecules and lack of ambition also kind of solved this afterwards as well so might write post in the future about that so was feeling bad during the day and of course had lots of negative thoughts arguing with people imagining bad outcomes in my day to day job being rejected by people and so what helped so at the beginning of the year had lot of anxiety both related to work and to my health incidentaly had increased my salt intake during one week and my blood pressure suffered so being the anxious person that am kept imagining it going so bad that d die and started having some kind of flashes of anxiety never had those before so the situation seemed to have gotten way worse than what it was previously the flashes were manifested in increased heart rate and tensing up probably my blood pressure suffered as well and also an array of negative thoughts so was laying one night in my bed and was going through the flashes couldn t help them whatever did told myself to just stop fucking thinking negatively and of course it didn t help then started to realize something it never helps anyone to tell them to stop doing something but instead reframe it amp motivate someone to start doing something that was the game changer told myself okay you re arguing with someone in your mind right now how about you hug them in instead so did and then how about they also apologize to you and tell you you been right all along this goes in the direction of the conflict been having with people who in my mind were telling me m wrong about some things and did and they apologized and started crying felt like the turntable has happened had to say it like that m the office fan was being engulfed with positive emotions like my body started to heal finally from all the trauma sadly or luckily because was about to learn how to strengthen my positive thinking another flash of anxiety amp negative thoughts came up as was having these nice thoughts after such long time no fuck you said to myself managed to turn them around into something positive again and more crying ensued from this point learned to start thinking positively in my life and found myself smiling constantly how does that look like well imagine goofy stuff which brings me lots of joy for example if was at pool and walked by three girls who by the way ignored me thought afterwards how they approached me and told me how nice look or if ended call job meeting which didn t like how it went imagined in my head that it went exactly how wanted it to go and that everyone praised me for my contributions it didn t matter that this didn t happen or maybe won t ever happen and wasn t delusional knew that was imagining it and that can not always be right or that can not be the prettiest guy in the room and that everyone will like me but in my mind was and boy did that change my perspective life it manifested some crazy good shit into reality just became of my positive framing what learned from it learned that had some unhealed trauma in my life and you might have guessed it about being right about being liked and so so in my mind started making up situations where was the prettiest was always right and that was having lovely time with everyone there were no arguments fights or things of that sort now have set up events in my calendar to remind me to think happy thoughts x per week and for minutes only come refreshed out of it whenever am feeling bad if remember to reframe those feelings or just think of something good happening to me do you wabunu denemek işe yarayıp yaramadığını bileceksiniz lütfen unutmayın kendiniz denerseniz işe yaramazsa bakış açınızı kötüden iyiye değiştirdiğinizde zihninizin hayır doğru olamaz sevilemiyorum deyip demediğini görmeye çalışın öyleyse mümkün olduğuna ikna edin zihniniz ilk başta durdurmaya çalışacaktır yıllardır yıllardır olmuştur muhtemelen bakış açınızı hızlı değiştirmenize izin vermeyecektir aynı zamanda bununla savaşmanız gerekebilir işe yaradığını bileceksiniz gerginlik azalmaya başlarsa vücudunuzda iyi hissetmeye başlarsınız ağlamaya başlarsınız çözülmemiş travma varsa gülümsemeye başlarsınız umarım azından kişiye yardımcı yardımcı iyi günler okuyucu komik hikaye ailemle öğle yemeği yiyordum sonunda kaygı konusunu açma cesaretini buldum tanımayı onunla başa çıkmayı öğrendiğime zeki doktora sahibi babama kaygısı olmadığını sordum olumsuz insan içindir dedi hey baba sence kaygın kaygı neslinin modern sorunu hayır sürekli olumsuz düşünceler düşünmek örneğin gerçekleşebilecek kötü senaryolar hakkında düşünmek hayır bende yok evet olumsuz senaryolar hakkında düşünüyorum engellemeye çalışıyorum örneğin kötü gidebilecek düşünüyorum gerçekten olduklarında hazırlıklı oluyorum sun tzu savaş okudun hazırlığın savaş sırasının söylemiş kaygının söyleyeceğimi düşünüyorum baba sürekli kafanın savaşa hazırlandığın anlamına geliyor hayat durup düşündü uzun zamandır yapmadığı şeydi genelde sadece cevapları kusuyor heh birinin alt etmesinden utanmıştır konuşmaları kazanmayı sever bence hayır umarım ana kadarki hayatı long post warning tl dr had nightmare edible trip few years ago and it seems to have permanently affected the way react to weed and increased my daily general anxiety looking for similar experiences hoping for some explanation or happy ending title says it all this incident happened about two years ago here s what can remember from the trip background smoked lot and off since was in my late teens now in my s had brief period of hard drug use then my wife helped me clean up my act and my life has been pretty sweet and my overall anxiety had been quite low for the past few years haven t had anything stronger than beer and some weed and generally that was fine until this incident happened never ever in my life had any sort of weed induced anxiety save for one time in high school when we got chased by the cops through park while stoned but an hour later we were just laughing about the experience do have general and social anxiety disorder but weed never amplified that in fact it was always the opposite where weed would calm me down and mellow me out it was like miracle drug never got stuck in my own head or anything like that until this happened this is important to note for the months leading up to this incident stopped smoking daily to focus work usually only getting stoned the weekends so my tolerance had dropped drove into the city to see movie hanging around outside beforehand took two edibles minutes apart each of which contained roughly g of some dispensary shit that had been mailed in to our state they were peanut butter firecrackers completely fucked up the dosage and accidentally put in about ten times as much as intended m bad at math that was my first mistake did not take into account the fact that had lower tolerance and just wanted to get ripped so gobbled them down and the die was cast someone talked to estimated that ingested at least mg of tch for reference think the dosage of most edibles these days for normal people hover around mg about min later we were sitting in the theater when the first one kicked in almost all at once for about minutes was giggling and feeling good then realized was way more stoned than expected it was kicking in too fast my heart was thumping and the second one hadn t kicked in yet so the anticipation of how much higher was about to get started to make me uncomfortable my only thought was the second one hasn t kicked in yet it hasn t kicked in yet holy shit this is going to be lot my hands began to tingle and got lightheaded and all of sudden my heartbeat and breathing seemed way too loud to be normal tried to calm myself by telling myself that was in movie theater and all had to do was sit and distract myself with the movie and that was when the paranoia started felt like everyone behind us was watching me started breathing really quickly and was just about to lean over and tell my wife when the second one kicked in just like the first one the second edible hit me in the head all at once like hammer blasted off for moment all could do was grip the arm rests as tightly as could and wheeze through my nose trying to control my breathing started drooling and sort of foaming at the mouth like dog my vision exploded into kaleidoscope of color but they weren t pleasant colors they were hostile and unnatural alien ones that only served to reinforce the idea that was not in comfortable and natural place felt like space monkey locked in some hateful alien zoo the small rounded lights the walkways seemed to me like eyes which were staring furiously at me lost the ability to hear things and all could sense out of my ears was low deep evil droning like ship s foghorn covered my ears but it didn t help so started shaking my head furiously whispering no no no at this point my wife looked over at me to see wtf was doing and she saw that was tripping out she whispered something to me but couldn t hear because had lost my ability to hear or discern human words voice made no sounds but teeth scared the shit out of me they looked like the angry teeth of shark she rubbed my hand and noticed was sweating bullets this was the last point where noticed anything about the movie sat in there for or so more minutes but despite watching the screen had no idea what was happening and might as well been like the dude from clockwork orange who was brainwashed with his eyes taped open right after the second one kicked in got stuck in mental thought loop where could not perceive any conscious thought other than this is your last day earth over and over again probably thought the phrase over thousand times as sat there the beatles song day in the life played loop in my mind but not the nice part the scary dissonant crescendo part the only words in my mind could hear were you re dying you re dying you re dying again and again had just enough of my wits left in me to realize that was about to puke so got up as normally as could wobbling and jerking and just pretended there was nobody else in the theater as made my way for the exit as walked my vision began to fail black spots dotted my scope of vision and things were morphing and shifting before me held the handrail as tightly as could and completely lost my frontal vision as soon as saw the bathroom so the last or so feet had to walk sideways like crab using my peripheral vision as could no longer see out of the front only the sides noticed one of the popcorn minions was watching me carefully so had to consciously act like wasn t drug addled lunatic because was terrified they d call the cops at the time we lived in non legal state made it to the bathroom just as the second edible peaked d wager it was abound to hours after ingestion although it felt more like or stumbled into stall and puked my guts out convinced myself my puke was full of blood and freaked out some more then sat down the toilet and tried to control my breathing but every time did d remember that my guts were bleeding and hyperventilate some more was distracted for moment when thought saw camera hidden in the stall lock and panicked some more because thought the people in the theater were watching me their phones through the camera in the bathroom this sent me into spiral so sat the toilet for while burying my face in my hands and crying at this point was wholly convinced of my imminent death there was no peace with it at all only pure blind primal panic nothing but adrenaline and the pounding of my own heart in my ears this period where was alone in the movie theater bathroom was one of the worst moments of my life overdosed cocaine and opiates before had severe alcohol poisoning hell have had several bad trips before both lsd and psilocybin but nothing compared to this what felt those psychedelic bad trips was fear yes but it was more like awe and amazement to the point that made me nervous and blew my mind and my fears then were result of my realization that was just teeny little insignificant part of the universe an acid trip cried but also laughed and loved acid was scary at times but it was good fear the kind that makes you grow as person my bad weed trip however had no insight to offer whatsoever there was no depth no connectedness no realizations only primal utter fear of the deepest kind that was disjointed and disharmonic like concentrated adrenaline and anxiety and confusion that was unrelenting unceasing and unyielding felt like lost child in some evil and foreign place and that would never see anyone or anything that love ever again just pure fear after about minutes in there which felt like few more hours my wife texted me asking if was okay she realized hadn t come back and left the theater and was waiting for me bench outside of the bathroom she offered to come in and help me but didn t want to draw more attention to myself so somehow managed to text and say need to just sit in here for minute she waited for me out there for about another minutes before telling me she wanted to come get me so she could drive us home at some point thought someone was banging my stall s door and trying to get at me someone screaming at me to come out right fucking now this very well could have been hallucination of psychosis and not real person don t know it wasn t my wife she waited outside for me as sent garbled text that d be out in minute my vision was still severely fucked up at this point and couldn t see very well so she took me by the arm and guided me out had to take the theater steps one at time like little old man because was so unsteady my feet somehow we made it to the car don t have any recollection of this journey remember walking out of the theater and then suddenly m in my car in the passenger seat cried little bit more and begged my wife not to drive yet because was paranoid thinking the police were watching us and would drop spike strips to run us off the road so we sat in the car for another minutes before she said fuck it and drove us home telling me d be more comfy if was tripping out in bed instead of in public think passed the peak somewhere the drive home because my vision and hearing started to come back to me and as soon as we got into the house descended from paranoid mania into just being super fucking stoned fell asleep almost immediately in my bed and was still ripped when woke up for work the next day was mentally fucked up for about two weeks after this experience felt semi stoned for solid days and my memory was affected for the next weeks after while tried to just laugh it off and my goal here is to provide some hope and insight for others that are experiencing anxiety by sharing my journey maybe can just help one person that is seeking answers like was this isn t some quick fix but simply what my experience was over years and maybe you can gather some useful info this post is mainly for people that have just recently stumbled into anxiety specifically after drug related event but it may help anyone about me had what like to call an going panic attack for about years it all started in my senior year of college had never really had anxiety before as would call it now would certainly get nervous and anxious about exams or fears but it was fairly minor would overthink stuff and have always been bit of hypochondriac but would never claimed myself as an anxious person that was until my first panic attack there was lot of stressors going my life at the time covid graduating college trying to figure out what to do with my life dating isolation etc decided that with my time in isolation during covid that would try edibles to help with the tough times was always bit of goody two shoes and never did any sort of drugs and would really only drink occasionally but at this point was desperate the first few times had lot of fun but after some time during the year decided to take an increased dosage as felt as though wasn t really having as much fun as the first time had done it went from taking usual mg to then deciding to take mg started to feel extremely anxious with an overwhelming sense of dread and fear as my whole body started freaking out this was my first panic attack had been playing video games at the time and was desperate to go to the er felt like was almost in time loop and lasted for hours and maybe at least what felt like that can t remember truly the worst experience of my entire life over the next few days still felt kinda bleh but it was something that was in the past the incident week goes by and m laying in bed my phone when all of sudden m feeling little anxious again until worked myself up about this feeling to end up having another panic attack this time was even scarier for me as didn t know why this was happening at least before knew it was the weed and it was something that happens to people this panic however didn t go away there was nothing that was consciously thinking about to make me feel this way was just in this loop of being anxious about being anxious days go by where this panic doesn t subside my whole body is shaking and m alone in my apartment horrified end up going to the er and they ended up giving me some fast acting anxiety medication this is when finally had found some small bit of peace this debilitating anxiety had gone from an to about at was no longer shaking but will still incredibly overwhelmed eventually ended up moving back home and my journey to get back to normal started now this anxiety wouldn t just come and go it was non stop from waking up in the morning to going to bed at night there was not single moment of peace it was always there but couldn t do anything about it this was just how was now and it was driving me to intense depression usually at its worst in the morning due to your high cortisol at that time your body is sensitive to that increase desperate for cure over this time looked into all kinds of things to fix this looking up my symptoms and finding stories reddit many of the things read often made me feel worse with people talking about how they got too high once and were forever changed was worried was going to develop schizophrenia and start to lose my mind and be swept away into mental hospital this however learned sadly little too late is something that so many people exactly think and it s just irrational thoughts that are incredibly common after so much research was convinced that there was something wrong with my body this anxiety isn t due to any sort of stress it was something wrong with my body and just had to find some fix for it tried therapy improving my gut health exercise meditation allergies journaling blood tests x rays and all kinds of other health stuff was so afraid that this was going to be my life forever and really wouldn t be able to take it much longer medication was my last resort medication was finally put buspirone mg and after weeks felt no change dont let that make you lose hope was convinced that even medication wouldn t be able to help me but after adding some other medications and increasing the dosage it finally stopped after months of trial this isn t me saying that medication fixes everything but just know that during my time had seen so many posts and people talking about how it didn t work for them so am working to show the brighter side of things during this time was unemployed and living at home but at around this time of getting ilaç kullanırken kaçış odası yerinde eğlenceli işe başladım işi sevdim insanları işi gerçekten ihtiyacım şeydi ilaçla birlikte sabah uyanmama süredir kaygılı hissetmediğimi fark etmeme yardımcı neredeyse yıllarca süren dayanılmaz korkudan sonunda teselli buldum iş yerinde benzer yaşamış birini buldum aynı düşüncelere sahipti şizofreni geliştirecekleri delireceklerdi ikimiz hayattan tekrar zevk alıyorduk geriye dönüp baktığımda sinir bozucu buluyorum korku yaşadıklarımı yaşamış iyi atlatmış birini ararken bulabildiğim tek korku hikayeleriydi insanlar yıllardır söylüyorlardı benzer umut bulmaya çalışırken duyulabilecek kötü buydu beyler hakkında düşünmeniz gerekmiyor iyi hikayeler bulmanın zor düşünüyorum zaman olumsuz so after years of trying to find the cure to my anxiety realised that it was right under my nose this whole time please take some time to read this in very short the key is self acceptance compassion and kindness learning how to love yourself unconditionally know you might be skeptical right now but promise that you need to hear this let me start by saying that what written here is universal and lot of it applies to everyone not just to people who are going through hard time with anxiety you don t suffer from anxiety you suffer from your reaction to it everyone feels fear everyone feels anxiety it s normal it s human and fearing from anxiety is the most human thing you don t suffer from the anxiety you suffer because of the way you perceive it you tell yourself that it s not okay that it s not normal you feel guilt and shame for feeling it you see it as bad thing you are scared for your life to feel it right now millions of people are having an anxiety attack millions are feeling so much anxiety millions are going through the same experience as you feeling so alone and defective feeling shame and guilt just for being an innocent human being with normal feelings know this your anxiety is not special your experience is not unique your thoughts and self dialog are not unique the sleepless nights that feel like the end of the world the feeling of dread the racing thoughts the dizziness you are not alone no matter how alone you might feel right now the things that make us feel the loneliest are the things that are the most common for all of us and what connects us all feelings such as guilt shame and also anxiety and depression these are things that we all have experienced in our life or experiencing right now but these are also the things we hide from others because we are too ashamed to admit it and too scared to be judged look at this sub alone it has k people in it videos about how to heal or deal with anxiety youtube have millions of views we all feel so alone in our experience while we all feel the same it s so absurd funny even in vicious way when we see these feelings as bad or negative this is when we will start trying to avoid feeling them what happens when you try not to think about something you will only think about it stop chasing after feeling good all the time you are allowed to feel like sh t if you were not supposed to feel this way then why do you because you were you born this way we are wired to have those feelings you are just like everyone else you can not be angry at yourself for that anxiety is not bad it s just feeling negative thoughts are not bad they are just negative they are things that just happen as result of you being human the first step is to be mindful of your thoughts this means to know and to be aware of what you are thinking recognise the anxious thoughts when they arise and accept them as part of your brain proccess thoughts just come up anxious thoughts just come up it just happens it s normal catch your brain when it starts spiralling and starts it s self dialog about anxiety it s harder to talk sense to yourself when you are already in panic because you are immersed in the feeling of danger sometimes you will feel anxiety maybe when you meet new people maybe for the stupidest reason and maybe for no reason and that s okay it just happens but it is your job to be there for yourself speak to yourself in gentle manner tell yourself oh that made you feel anxious didn t it it s totally normal to feel what you feel m here for you love always make sure to listen to yourself ask yourself are you comfortable doing this it s okay if you are not whatever you feel like m so happy that you are here with me hug yourself realise how innocent you are you are giving your right now appreciate yourself for that if you knew better you would have acted it but what if stay this way my entire life let me tell you secret this might be little harsh but feel like many of us need to hear this your life is not that important you might feel anxiety right now but it doesn t matter the world will just keep revolving millions of people are suffering right now some feel depressed and can t get out of their bed some are stressed over things that won t matter tomorrow some are crying in the shower some are struggling with their body image some feel so small and unworthy some countless of people you get it we all suffer we all have problems we are dealing with right now this is the curse or gift that life is we are all going towards the same destination anyway yes we are all destined to die maybe today maybe tomorrow maybe in years you and your loved ones might be gone by tomorrow and it won t change thing we are all nothing in this universe in years you and everyone you know will be gone and no one will care you might think this is pessimistic thing to say but it isn t it s realistic in fact the most important people earth right now the richest the most famous might be gone by tomorrow and it won t really affect anyone or change their life course would it change your life in any way so you will suffer your entire life so you will waste your entire life big deal so many did before you you are just another person you will die anyway so feel what you feel feel like sh t feel awesome it won t change thing not now not in years and not in years and if there is no point then you are free to just exist just feel whatever it is that you are feeling nothing that you do will change the order of the universe when you realise that nothing you do think or feel really has an impact and that your days here are limited it might start to feel little pointless to even worry about things you said yesterday or feel guilt for your experience like it s gon na end anyway so why bother this is when you start feeling grateful for any experience that you are going through you just notice it without judging it you accept it as something that will pass and won t be remembered you don t need to let go of anxiety be okay with yourself even when you feel anxiety get good at feeling uncomfortable learn to even love it tell yourself you are so human and love you just for that remember this moment is perfectly fine bodily discomfort is just bodily discomfort it s temporarily state do you think you are gon na remember this moment in years will it matter is it gon na affect your life in any way life changes all the time we forget what we felt yesterday so quickly what you feel right now is not what you are gon na feel tomorrow today you might feel confident and tomorrow you might feel less confident and that s okay the point is to learn to love yourself no matter what no matter what you feel think say love yourself unconditionally you are not perfect whatever you feel right now is okay and allowed and was felt by millions of others before you you are imperfect you can make mistakes you don t have to say the right thing all the time you don t have to feel good all the time you are human you are f ing human and you deserve unconditional love just for that stop labeling yourself you are not an anxious person you just don t accept this part of you as normal you just don t have the tools and perspective tomorrow this might change heck maybe even today maybe right now when finally felt this love and compassion towards myself when just let things be without judging whether they are good or bad thought to myself didn t even realise that you could love yourself this way didn t realise how much shame and guilt carried within myself for feeling anxiety or having certain thoughts used to beat myself down feeling like victim thinking but just wanted to enjoy life why am so miserable what s wrong with me now realise that there was absolutely nothing wrong suffered because judged this feeling judged and criticized myself was so harsh with myself and others instead now try to have an honest conversation with myself learn to have honest conversation with yourself it could be useful when feeling overwhelmed ask yourself what are you feeling right now you can tell me everything in the most non judgemental way possible get comfortable with being vulnerable with yourself it might feel very cringe at first but trust me you get used to it negative thougts just happen laugh at them they are so hysterical whenever difficult thought arises whenever you feel anxiety tell yourself it s okay feel anxiety you re allowed to it s human love you am always here for you some resistance might arise when you say that take deep breath and accept these thoughts too by repeating love you including all these thoughts and resistance let it be laugh at this human nature and how stupidly imperfect we all are if the anxiety is really strong right now and you can not think properly just note to yourself that once you feel better you will be back and you will always be there for yourself let the anxiety run its course now and know that eventually you will have yourself again you always have place to come back to someone to lean treat yourself gently like you would treat good friend child pet toddler in way it s almost like reparenting yourself reassure yourself with kind words you are just as innocent and deserving of love and kindness develop your own positive self dialog say the things that you feel you might need to hear always be there for yourself no matter what don t love yourself despite of feeling anxiety and fear love yourself because of that because what you feel is normal and understandable every bit of it there is no cure for being human so stop apologizing for being one amp x b things that helped me book the subtle art of not giving f k by mark manson you probably heard of this one some helpful videos self compassion
